Name: Apple pie
Instructions: First, prepare the dough: in a big bowl put 2 glasses of flour, 1 egg, 1/4 glass (80g) of sugar, 1 block of butter, 2 tsp baking powder and a pinch of salt.
Knead the dough promptly and when it's ready, form it into a ball and cover in foil. Put in the fridge for at least an hour (can be longer).
Peal the apples, cut them into quarters getting rid of the core and place them in a pot. Add cinamon and cook the apples until theyâ€™re soft.

After an hour take the dough out of the fridge, and divide into 2 even parts. Put 1 of them in the freezer. Cover the bottom and the sides of the baking tray with baking paper and place there the rolled dough.
Place apples on top of your dough.
Take the 2nd part of the dough out of the freezer and grate it, covering the top of your apple pie.
Place the apple pie in the preheated oven to 180 Celsius degrees on the middle shelf. Bake the pie for an hour (up to 70mins) depending on your oven size and power.
Take the apple pie out of the oven and enjoy!
